categories.title: Commits Overview: Code Fixes and Improvements in ElizaOS Repository

content.text: Several commits were made to address and fix typing errors and logical issues within the ElizaOS codebase. Issues were partially to fully resolved, with some requiring future review due to complex logic.
Plugins such as quai and opacity underwent significant fixes relating to logical and typing errors. Improvements included removing unnecessary console logs and integrating the use of elizaLogger.
Security updates and dependency upgrades were merged, focusing on enhancing the security posture of the software by updating systeminformation and pnpm versions to address known vulnerabilities.
Additional project maintenance involved adjusting configurations and documentation, as well as correcting typos across different code files to improve clarity and maintainability.
Merge operations were carried out to incorporate changes from the develop branch into various feature or fix branches, ensuring updated and streamlined codebase alignments.
Additionally, there was a focus on improving logging and error handling, integrating more robust mechanisms using elizaLogger for enhanced diagnostics and monitoring.

categories.title: Issues and Feature Requests in ElizaOS

content.text: The {{maxTweetLength}} template tag doesn't work because it doesn't exist in the tweet post template. A possible solution might involve passing custom inputs into composeContext or directly populating maxTweetLength before sending it to composeContext.

A feature request to have runtime configuration expose several settings like Lore count, Post Example count, Bio count, and others. Suggestions include documenting these parameters thoroughly and possibly configuring chunkSize and bleed for knowledge processing.
A feature request to implement reranked contextual embedding with cBM25 as the default Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system in ElizaOS, inspired by a method described in the Anthropic blog.

An issue where setting messageCount to unique=true causes it to always return 1, breaking the facts feature. The suggestion is to set unique=false to resolve the issue, but the validate logic remains confusing and could be improved.

The ragKnowledge component retrieves entire documents at runtime, making prompts excessively long. A proposed fix includes avoiding embedding entire documents or filtering them. There is code duplication between processFile and createKnowledge that could be cleaned up.
A proposal to consolidate RAGKnowledge into Knowledge to prevent overlap and confusion within the system.
A suggestion to move text splitting functionality into the core and remove dependencies on langchain.

Issues related to handling embeddings include the need for dynamic embedding tables due to differing lengths, the suggestion to move hardcoded embedding handling to plugins, and the necessity of default models in multi-plugin contexts.
A bug where the Eliza chatbot client fails to connect on http://localhost:5173/, showing a disconnect while the REST API runs smoothly on port 3000.
A bug in the plugin-solana where the SEND_TOKEN action verification always returns false, hindering transaction confirmations, especially compared to other actions like EXECUTE_SWAP.
An error in the Ollama API with the llava model results in JSON parsing issues and repetitive tweet content, further compounded by delayed or non-responsive behavior from the localhost chat.

When an agent sends multiple tweets, the reply to chain is disrupted as the second tweet responds to the user's original tweet rather than the agent's initial tweet. This may require changing how initial tweet IDs are stored or handled.
A feature request to add a prefill prompt feature in the character.json configuration for service providers like Anthropic and GoogleAI.
After updating to the latest version, users are facing experimental warnings and module import errors related to node and ts-node.
Deepseek chats sometimes append unwanted text like (NONE) or (CONTINUE), requiring code hacks to exclude these from responses.
We're thrilled to announce AI Model with Real Crypto Intelligence, analyzing millions of data points.
Deploying a DeepSeek AI model with ElizaOS AI agent is made easy with Phala Network TEE cloud.
Upcoming Episode 4 of Tanssi Cast focuses on the year of AI Agents in Web3, airing tomorrow at 10 AM ET.
Progress update on automating DAO communications and PR, moving towards AI-led DAO solutions.

The cryptocurrency market is exhibiting a diverse range of performances among its top assets. The ai16z token currently trades at $0.5684, with a market capitalization of $625,255,779 and a significant daily decrease of 20%. It sees a 24-hour trading volume of $10,141,127.19.

Bitcoin continues to dominate the market with a hefty price tag of $101,759 and an impressive market cap of $2,016,422,202,030. The 24-hour volume for Bitcoin is $42,000,835,830, and it experiences a notable daily price increase of 126.949%.

Ethereum, a prominent player in the crypto market, is currently priced at $3,110.54 with a market capitalization of $374,502,011,554. Its 24-hour trading volume is $19,877,256,221, and it suffers a decrease in daily value amounting to -49.2194%.
Solana is trading at $229.08, registering a market cap of $111,493,827,193 with a daily decrease of 5.1025%. The 24-hour trading activity amounts to $5,660,762,875.
Galadriel AI has partnered with ai16zdao to enable the use of a verified inference API for proving Eliza agents on-chain on the Solana blockchain, aiming to increase trust in the platform.
There is a mention of 'Probably nothing...' related to cryptocurrency, specifically referencing $ai16z and $arc.

We're thrilled about the launch of the AI Model with Real Crypto Intelligence by @BuildOnCyber. This innovative model is capable of analyzing millions of transactions for enhanced crypto intelligence.
Galadriel is partnering with @ai16zdao to provide a verified inference API. This tool helps prove Eliza agents on-chain on Solana while increasing trust.
Deploying a @deepseek_ai model @ElizaOS_ai AI agent is streamlined with @PhalaNetwork's TEE cloud.
Tanssi Network is excited to release Episode 4 of Tanssi Cast, focusing on the Year of AI Agents in Web3.
A new update on automating DAO communications and PR indicates significant progress towards an AI-led DAO, along with links to the source code.
Development of a CLI with TEE deployment support for ElizaOS illustrates support for both v1 and v2.
New video release covering the creation of a custom ElizaOS AI Agent Plugin from scratch, taking the viewer from zero to live in just 35 minutes.
